title: For Sale/Trade:  One mean .40!! Like new Taurus PT101P. The Beretta 96 but built better!!
postcontent:
Sold!!!!

Are you looking for a tough as nails pistol in a big bore caliber that can take whatever you put it through? This is it.....

This is a like new Taurus pt101p. It is chambered in .40s&w. This is exactly like the beretta 96 but built alot better. It will swap with a ton of beretta 92/96 parts and can use the beretta 96 mags with a small modification to the mag. I own several beretta 92's and 96's and then i did the research. The beretta has plastic internals (even the guide rods are plastic!) where as the Taurus is all metal. Taurus bought the factory, the machines and the patents for the m9/92/96 series and made them better with metal internals and the safety/decocker on the frame instead of the slide. Brilliant! But anyways, about the gun.......

This is the "p" series that holds more than the original pt100/101. (will also accept the 18/20/30rd mags) It has had no malfunctions at all since i've owned it! Comes with the white 3-dot adjustable night sights , 2-16rd mags, Hogue rubberized grips, the rail underneath for a light/laser, the factory box with manual, factory keys to the taurus locking system and the original purchase reciept. This is a dependable, trust your life to it, end of the world pistol that has been taken very good care of and is a blast to shoot. Has been kept clean and oiled and it was cleaned/oiled at the range right after shooting. I dont want to sell it but I need to get a 9mm (looking for a Taurus pt92/pt99 but you never know) and something else (cash, a shotgun, a rifle etc.). My wife and I are smaller people so the .40 is a little much. That is the only reason i am selling/trading it. 

REDUCED!!!.......$475 cash price but would rather trade.  Face to Face in Tulsa only, will not ship. Must be a NON-FELON, have a valid drivers license and be willing to sign a bill of sale/trade.

Wanting cash but might trade for a Taurus pt92/pt99 9mm and a pt22 (.22lr) or a 12 gauge and some cash or a 357 and cash or the mossberg zombie 30-30 and.....?..... Just ask, I'm a gun lover so you never know, I might be interested. Must have pics you can email. I dont have pic messaging on my phone.

** If interested......email, call or text....
     nine one 8-5 seven seven-7 six six 6.

----If i miss your call please leave a message and I'll call you back. If you dont leave a message, I wont know you called.  

Thank you for looking.

title: For Sale:  Custom AR-15 in 7.62x39 with Colt upper
postcontent:
Up for sale is my custom AR-15 in 7.62x39mm. It is in like-new condition, with less than 50 rounds through it. It works perfectly, no jams. It is built around a Pre-Ban Colt 16" flat-top upper on a Mega Arms forged lower. It has a 6-position stock and a C-Products 10 round stainless steel magazine. The lower parts kit is DPMS. The pivot pin is DPMS, not Colt. The original box for the Colt upper will be included, although I don't have any of the original Colt paperwork. Also, please note that this takes AR-15 style mags (in 7.62x39, of course) and not AK-47 mags. High-quality, US-made, stainless steel magazines made by C Products Defense are readily available this rifle for in 5, 10, and 30 round capacities. In fact, I have some of each, and you can have them for what I paid for them.

The Colt upper is in original Colt configuration, although it wasn't always that way. I had replaced the Colt front sight/gas block and gas tube with a custom gas system (I can provide photos if you'd like). I had also replaced the Colt flash hider with a PWS recoil brake. I have removed all those parts, though, and reinstalled the Colt parts. However, there is now a small set screw mark on the barrel and you can tell the front sight pins were taken out and reinstalled. There are also very minor marks (rubbed edges, really) on some of the Picatinny rail slots from where I once mounted a scope and, later, a rail riser.  Still, the whole gun is in excellent condition and looks virtually brand new.

I am also selling the many accessories I have for this gun, at the cost I paid for them 2-3 years ago. These include a UTG soft case, several C-Products magazines (various sizes), a Harris sling swivel/bipod adapter, a UTG bipod, a Tapco recoil pad, a Daniel Defense heavy buffer, an NcSTAR ACOG clone scope with integrated laser, an NcSTAR red dot sight scope, a Yankee Hill Machine rail riser, a Midwest Industries low-profile gas block, an MGI regulated/adjustable gas tube, a custom grip, a PWS recoil brake, a Brownell's stock wrench, a couple spare Olympic 7.62x39mm bolts, a spare DPMS lower parts kit, and a UTG adjustable rear sight. Almost all of these are brand new, the rest are like new.  Email me if you are interested in any of these, as I have a comprehensive list with prices, links, etc.

I'm asking $999 plus actual shipping for the complete rifle or $749 plus actual shipping for just the upper. These prices are firm, as I am not willing to lose money on this if I don't have to.

I will only sell this to someone who has legitimate feedback on eBay or Gunbroker or long-standing forum activity on a gun forum.

I am not interested in any trades whatsoever.

title: For Sale:  Taurus PT809c (compact) Stainless, two 13-rnd mags, box
postcontent:
Offered for sale: A Taurus PT809c in stainless - this handgun is the compact model, and is beautiful, trim, 100% reliable with every kind of ammo I've ever stuck in it, and wicked accurate.

Owned the gun 1.5 years. It shows no evidence of holster wear; the stainless is wicked hard on this gun. It has never failed to feed, fire or eject - not once in 600 rounds I've put through it.

Note that this gun has a decocker and a safety, and the 800-series guns are hammer-fired - so if you don't like striker-fired guns, this one is for you.

I have the box, one 13-round and one 17-round magazine, the manuals, a brush, a magazine loader.



The gun is compact (3.5" bbl), and very flat for a double-stack magazine-fed gun. The trigger pull is crisp in SA, and the DA pull is long but smooth. It's very safe to carry and so comfortable and light that it is perfect. It's really been a gem, but I fell in love with a Turkish beauty and have been carrying her instead ever since.

I can be reached at REDACTED and at REDACTED.

title: For Trade:  Mosin PEM sniper and 91/30
postcontent:
Have 2 rifles up for trade, one is a PEM 91/30 sniper and the other is a plain 91/30. Both are all matching, the scope mount on the PEM is stamped matching to the rest of the rifle. Both are 1943 Izhevsk's, and have outstanding bores, plus they shoot great. The PEM gets about 1.5" groups with standard Russian copper-wash surplus ammo, and the 91/30 gets about 3" (both at 100yds.). The PEM is a reproduction, as they no longer made PEM sniper rifles in 1943, however it was very nicely done and there are no visible import marks. I am looking to trade these two rifles (together) for something new, as my Russian mosin collection has grown a little out of control, and since I already have 2 other PEM's (one being an original Tula), I figure I'd offer it up for someone who wants one but doesn't want to pay $3k + for an original or wait to have a gunsmith tackle it. I haven't seen many PEM's (original or repro) pop up on the web for a long time, so once this one goes, that may be it for a long time. 

Here's a list of things I am looking for:
- Finnish Mosins (M91's, M27's, M28's)
- FAL 
- Romanian PSL
- An AK variant (such as a Yugo M72, no WASR's)
- (2) Unissued Yugo SKS's (I can throw a little cash your way too)
